summary: The European Statistical System (ESS) is a framework established to ensure the production and dissemination of high-quality statistical information within the European Union. It encompasses national statistical institutes and Eurostat, the statistical office of the EU, facilitating harmonized data collection and analysis. The ESS operates under the legal framework provided by EU regulations, ensuring compliance with principles of impartiality, reliability, and confidentiality. This system plays a crucial role in economic analysis, supporting evidence-based policymaking and enhancing transparency in governance. By fostering collaboration among member states, the ESS contributes to the coherence and comparability of statistics across the EU.
